intro: Hieraciodes rigens, commonly known as the rigid hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers appear in late summer. Hieraciodes rigens is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
